intro: Lindernia crenata, commonly known as the mossy lindernia, is a flowering plant native to parts of the southern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with wavy edges, and small, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its ability to thrive in humid conditions. Lindernia crenata is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
